data.title: David Jared Kobulnicky, MD
data.meta_description: VOA's oncologist, David Jared Kobulnicky, MD specializes in medical oncology and hematology. He sees patients in Hampton and Newport News, VA.
data.text:
Medical School

Medical College of Virginia, Virginia Commonwealth University

Residency

Medical College of Virginia, Virginia Commonwealth University

Fellowship

Medical College of Virginia, Virginia Commonwealth University

Board Certification

Medical Oncology

Hematology

Affiliations

Assistant Professor at Edward Via College of Osteopathic Medicine

Biography

Dr. Jared Kobulnicky earned his medical degree and later completed his Internal Medicine residency and Hematology and Oncology fellowship at the Medical College of Virginia (Virginia Commonwealth University). His research has been presented at the American Society of Hematology and the American Society for Blood and Marrow Transplantation. His work has been published in Leukemia and Lymphoma, Frontiers in Immunology and Biology of Blood and Marrow Transplantation. He was inducted into Alpha Omega Alpha in 2021. He was also awarded the Arthur P. Gold Award for his humanistic and compassionate care. Dr. Kobulnicky has been voted a Coastal Virginia Magazine Top Doc by his peers in 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024.

Dr. Kobulnicky's interests include blood cancers such as leukemia, lymphoma and multiple myeloma and cancers of the breast, lung and head and neck.

In his free time, he enjoys spending time with his family, cycling and gardening. He is a strong proponent of cancer research as well as patient-centered care. Dr. Kobulnicky looks forward to providing excellent cancer care in the Hampton Roads community.

Listen to our podcast featuring Dr. Jared Kobulnicky.
